benchmark_details.name: VisTW (Vision-Language Benchmark for Traditional Chinese)
benchmark_details.overview: VisTW is a comprehensive evaluation benchmark for Vision-Language Models in Traditional Chinese, consisting of two components: VisTW-MCQ, a collection of multiple-choice questions from 21 subjects, and VisTW-Dialogue, focusing on open dialogue in Taiwanese cultural contexts.
similar_benchmarks: TMMLU (Traditional Chinese Massive Multitask Language Understanding)

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the performance of Vision-Language Models in understanding and generating Traditional Chinese in the context of Taiwanese culture.

data.source: Collected from various Taiwanese educational assessments and manually curated image-question pairs from real-life scenarios.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on accuracy of responses and correlation between model scores and human evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in understanding and reasoning about Traditional Chinese cultural contexts.
methodology.validation: Model performance is validated against human scores through multiple evaluation frameworks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes diverse geographic sampling across Taiwan.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Images were collected with consent and no personally identifiable information was included.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Contributors explicitly waived ownership rights for the images used in the benchmark.
